cf.lukasheinzl.crypto

Class FileEncrypter

  • java.lang.Object
    • cf.lukasheinzl.crypto.FileEncrypter

  • public class FileEncrypter
extends java.lang.Object
    Used to encrypt/decrypt Files using Keys
    Author:
    Lukas Heinzl

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static byte[] decryptFile(java.lang.String file, java.lang.String algorithm, Key key, boolean write)
      Used to decrypt a File with a given decryption algorithm and key
      static byte[] encryptFile(java.lang.String file, java.lang.String algorithm, Key key, boolean write)
      Used to encrypt a File with a given encryption algorithm and key

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • encryptFile

        public static byte[] encryptFile(java.lang.String file,
                                 java.lang.String algorithm,
                                 Key key,
                                 boolean write)
                          throws CryptoException,
                                 java.io.IOException
        Used to encrypt a File with a given encryption algorithm and key
        Parameters:
        file - The path to the file to encrypt
        algorithm - The name of the encryption algorithm to use
        key - The Key to use for the encryption
        write - If this boolean is set to true the encrypted bytes will be written to the file
        Returns:
        A byte[] containing the encrypted data
        Throws:
        CryptoException - If the encryption algorithm could not be found or the encryption failed
        java.io.IOException - If the file could not be found or read / written
        See Also:
        NoSuchAlgorithmException, InvalidKeyException

      • decryptFile

        public static byte[] decryptFile(java.lang.String file,
                                 java.lang.String algorithm,
                                 Key key,
                                 boolean write)
                          throws CryptoException,
                                 java.io.IOException
        Used to decrypt a File with a given decryption algorithm and key
        Parameters:
        file - The path to the file to decrypt
        algorithm - The name of the decryption algorithm to use
        key - The Key to use for the decryption
        write - If this boolean is set to true the decrypted bytes will be written to the file
        Returns:
        A byte[] containing the decrypted data
        Throws:
        CryptoException - If the decryption algorithm could not be found or the decryption failed
        java.io.IOException - If the file could not be found or read / written
        See Also:
        NoSuchAlgorithmException, InvalidKeyException
